p: While it is important to survey wildlife showing clinical signs of disease, most viruses are discovered in bats from asymptomatic animals, and a two-pronged approach of screening both healthy and diseased animals is required [ 122]. Modeling approaches to target bat host species based on life-history traits [ 123, 124] or viral “habitat” suitability using ecological niche models [ 71, 72, 73] can both be used to refine the taxonomic and geographic scale of surveillance for novel filoviruses or novel filovirus host species.
